com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.event.Observable, com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.IconSupport, com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasAttachHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget
public class ChartFrame
extends com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.widget.ContentPanel

Extended container for HighChart. Provides a set of menu items for manipulating the encapsulated chart.

Author:
Daniele Strollo

setInheritHeight

public final void setInheritHeight(boolean value)
Looks up for its ancestors to find the right size matching the minimal requirements of minHeights.

setInheritWeight

public final void setInheritWeight(boolean value)
Looks up for its ancestors to find the right size matching the minimal requirements of minWidth.

setMinHeight

public final void setMinHeight(int minHeight)
Sets the minHeight to resolve in recursion solving of parents height in resize.

Usually not required. It is enough to set the size of its container. For example, if inside a portlet, use the method portlet.setHeight(...) before adding this component inside it.

setMinWidth

public final void setMinWidth(int minWidth)
Sets the minWidth to resolve in recursion solving of parents width in resize.

Usually not required. It is enough to set the size of its container. For example, if inside a portlet, use the method portlet.setHeight(...) before adding this component inside it.

clearToolbar

public final void clearToolbar()
The default toolbar is automatically generated. If you want to customize it, you need to perform the following options: 
 chartFrame.clearToolbar();
 
 // Creates a button Options with a submenu with the following plugins 
 this.addPlugin("Options", new PlgInvertAxis(this.chart));
 this.addPlugin("Options", new PlgShowHideMarker(this.chart));
 this.addPlugin("Options", new PlgShowHideDataLabels(this.chart));
 this.addPlugin("Options", new PlgSharedTooltip(this.chart));

java.lang.Exception
